name: Short Task
statement: Let us denote by $$$d(n)$$$ the sum of all divisors of the number $$$n$$$, i.e. $$$d(n) = \sum\limits_{k | n} k$$$. For example, $$$d(1) = 1$$$, $$$d(4) = 1+2+4=7$$$, $$$d(6) = 1+2+3+6=12$$$. For a given number $$$c$$$, find the minimum $$$n$$$ such that $$$d(n) = c$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$). Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow. Each test case is characterized by one integer $$$c$$$ ($$$1 \le c \le 10^7$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output: " -1 " if there is no such $$$n$$$ that $$$d(n) = c$$$; $$$n$$$, otherwise.
